unnormalised: **Logistics Delays Hamper Manufacturing Output in Key Industrial Hubs**
normalised: **Logistics Delays Hamper Manufacturing Output in Key Industrial Hubs**

unnormalised: Manufacturing output in Maharashtra and Tamil Nadu is facing headwinds due to persistent logistics delays, industry sources report. Container shortages and port congestion, particularly at JNPT near Mumbai and Chennai Port Trust, continue to plague the supply chain.
normalised: Manufacturing output in Maharashtra and Tamil Nadu is facing headwinds due to persistent logistics delays, industry sources report. Container shortages and port congestion, particularly at J N P T near Mumbai and Chennai Port Trust, continue to plague the supply chain.

unnormalised: Dr. Rajesh Kumar, President of the All India Manufacturers' Association (AIMA), stated that delays are adding approximately 15-20% to production costs. "We are seeing raw materials stuck in transit for weeks," he said. Many factories are now operating at reduced capacity.
normalised: Doctor Rajesh Kumar, President of the All India Manufacturers' Association (A I M A), stated that delays are adding approximately fifteen to twenty percent to production costs. "We are seeing raw materials stuck in transit for weeks," he said. Many factories are now operating at reduced capacity.

unnormalised: Road freight bottlenecks, especially on the Delhi-Mumbai Industrial Corridor, further exacerbate the problem. Several manufacturers are considering relocating facilities to areas with better logistical connectivity, despite the higher upfront Rs. investment.
normalised: Road freight bottlenecks, especially on the Delhi-Mumbai Industrial Corridor, further exacerbate the problem. Several manufacturers are considering relocating facilities to areas with better logistical connectivity, despite the higher upfront rupee investment.

unnormalised: A recent survey by CRISIL indicated that warehousing space utilization in the Bhiwandi logistics park (over 10 million sq ft) is nearing capacity, hindering storage efficiency and contributing to delivery backlogs. These delays threaten to impact festive season demand fulfillment, particularly for consumer goods. The average truck turnaround time between Chennai and Kolkata has reportedly increased by 36 hours. Solutions are urgently needed.
normalised: A recent survey by C R I S I L indicated that warehousing space utilization in the Bhiwandi logistics park (over ten million square feet) is nearing capacity, hindering storage efficiency and contributing to delivery backlogs. These delays threaten to impact festive season demand fulfillment, particularly for consumer goods. The average truck turnaround time between Chennai and Kolkata has reportedly increased by thirty six hours. Solutions are urgently needed.
